page.title: 04Sandbeck Game
page.content: Lord Scarbrough,who lives at Sandbeck Hall,employs three{gamekeepers}and one head gamekeeper.Their job is to look after the{game}and make sure there is sufficient for the shoots.They also have to keep down the{vermin.Pheasants are caught in late January and put into a very large pen in the wood.They lay from April to June and their eggs are collected daily and put into an{ {incubator}for 20 days,after which the fertile eggs are transferred to a{ {hatchery}where the chicks hatch after 4 or 5 days.Each bird lays about{30 {eggs}per season and one egg is worth { {70p.}They import{partridge}eggs from Denmark at a cost of{Â£1.20}each.This year Sandbeck Farms have bought 8000 partridge eggs.The shooting season begins on 1st Sept for partridges and 1st Oct for pheasants.They sell{ {oven-ready}birds at{Â£4-Â£5}per{brace.}
